title: AI Architecture & Strategy - Oil & Gas Sector - Senior Manager - Consulting - Location OPEN
description:
At EY, youâ€™ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And weâ€™re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.
Â 
The exceptional EY experience. It's yours to build.
Â 
EY focuses on high-ethical standards and integrity among its employees and expects all candidates to demonstrate these qualities.
Â 
Oil & Gas Sector, Senior Manager, Data AnalyticsÂ 
EY delivers unparalleled service in big data, business intelligence, and digital analytics built on a blend of custom-developed methods related to customer analytics, data visualization, and optimization. We leverage best practices and a high degree of business acumen that has been compiled over years of experience to ensure the highest level of execution and satisfaction for our clients.Â  At EY, our methods are not tied to any specific platforms but rather arrived at by analyzing business needs and making sure that the solutions delivered meet all client goals.Â 
Â 
The opportunityÂ 
We are looking for a Data Analytics Leader to join our team and help us deliver data-driven insights and solutions to our oil & gas clients. You will help our clients navigate the complex world of modern data science and analytics.Â  Weâ€™ll look to you to provide our clients with a unique business perspective on how data science and analytics can transform and improve their entire organization â€“ starting with key business issues they face.Â  This is a high growth, high visibility area with plenty of opportunities to enhance your skillset and build your career.Â 
Â 
Your key responsibilitiesÂ 
Youâ€™ll spend most of your time architecting solutions and managing client engagement teams, working with a wide variety of clients to deliver professional services, and managing business development activities on strategic and global priority accounts.Â 


Define and execute the analytics strategy and roadmap for oil & gas clients, aligning with their business objectives and challengesÂ 




Lead and mentor a team of analysts, ensuring high-quality deliverables, timely execution, and effective communicationÂ 




Design and implement analytical frameworks, models, and dashboards to address complex business problems and generate actionable insightsÂ 




Leverage advanced analytics techniques, such as machine learning, optimization, simulation, and forecasting, to optimize operational efficiency, optimize carbon intensity, reduce costs, and improve performanceÂ 




Communicate and present analytical findings and recommendations to senior management and clients, using clear and compelling visualizations and narrativesÂ 




Establish and maintain strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders, including business leaders, engineers, and domain expertsÂ 




Stay updated on the latest trends, technologies, and best practices in the oil & gas industry and the analytics domainÂ 


Â 
Skills and attributes for successÂ 


Assisting in the strategy and implementation of Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Big Data, and modern Information Management Â 




Helping our clients make data-driven decisions by working with structured and unstructured data sets, building out predictive models and advising our clients on data mining leading practicesÂ 




Building and applying data analysis algorithms (data mining, statistics, machine learning, natural language processing, sentiment analysis, text mining, etc.) as appropriateÂ Â 




Designing, architecting and developing solutions leveraging big data technology (Open Source, Hortonworks, AWS or Microsoft) to ingest, process and analyze large, disparate data sets to exceed business requirementsÂ 




Leading large-scale client engagements.Â  Fostering relationships with client personnel at appropriate levels. Consistently delivering quality client services. Driving high-quality work products within expected timeframes and on budget.Â Â 




Monitoring progress, managing risk and ensuring key stakeholders are kept informed about progress and expected outcomes.Â Â 




Provides directional guidance and recommendations around data technology, data models, and data storage formatsÂ 




Managing expectations of client service delivery.Â Â 




Staying abreast of current business and industry trends relevant to the client's businessÂ 




Effectively managing and motivating client engagement teams with diverse skills and backgrounds. Providing constructive on- the- job feedback/coaching to team members.Â Â 




Fostering an innovative and inclusive team- oriented work environment. Playing an active role in counselling and mentoring junior consultants within the organizationÂ 




Cultivating and managing business development opportunities. Developing and maintaining long- term client relationships and networks.Â 


Â 
To qualify for the role, you must haveÂ 


A bachelorâ€™s degree or higher in a quantitative field, such as mathematics, statistics, engineering, computer science, or economicsÂ 




At least 5 years of relevant experience in analytics, preferably in the oil & gas industry or a related sectorÂ 




Proficiency in data analysis, data visualization, and data storytelling, using tools such as SQL, Python, R, Power BI, Tableau, Cognite, Palantir, Dataiku, or similarÂ 




Experience in applying advanced analytics techniques, such as machine learning, optimization, simulation, and forecasting, to solve real-world problemsÂ 




Experience implementing AI/ML Ops, Model Release Management, Model TrainingÂ 




Experience using data mining and statistical toolsÂ 




Solid pattern recognition and predictive modelling skillsÂ Â 




Recommendation engines, scoring systems, A/B testingÂ 




Thorough business understanding of data science application and ability to communicate with key decision-makersÂ 




Hands-on experience with various big data technologies in one or more ecosystems (Hadoop, AWS or Microsoft)Â 




Experience in leading and managing teams, projects, and stakeholders, with strong leadership, project management, and communication skillsÂ 




A valid driverâ€™s license in the US; willingness and ability to travel to meet client needs.Â 


Â 
Ideally, youâ€™ll also haveÂ 


Bachelorâ€™s Degree or above in mathematics, information systems, statistics, computer science, or related disciplinesÂ Â 




Experience with Azure Data Factory and AzureML a plusÂ 


Â 
What we look forÂ 
Weâ€™re interested in passionate leaders with strong vision and a desire to stay on top of trends in the Data Science and Big Data industry. If you have a genuine passion for helping businesses achieve the full potential of their data, this role is for you.Â 
Â 
Â 
What we offer
Â 
We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package where youâ€™ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to the business. The base salary range for this job in all geographic locations in the US is $142,600 to $325,800. The salary range for New York City Metro Area, Washington State and California (excluding Sacramento) is $171,100 to $370,300. Individual salaries within those ranges are determined through a wide variety of factors including but not limited to education, experience, knowledge, skills and geography. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Join us in our team-led and leader-enabled hybrid model. Our expectation is for most people in external, client serving roles to work together in person 40-60% of the time over the course of an engagement, project or year. Under our flexible vacation policy, youâ€™ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. Youâ€™ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.
Â 

Continuous learning: Youâ€™ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
Success as defined by you: Weâ€™ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Transformative leadership: Weâ€™ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
Diverse and inclusive culture: Youâ€™ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

Â 
EY accepts applications for this position on an on-going basis. If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.
Â 
EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.
Â 
Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.
Â 
Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.
Â 
For those living in California, please click here for additional information.
Â 
EY is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer providing equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, pregnancy, genetic information, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other legally protected basis, including arrest and conviction records, in accordance with applicable law.
Â 
EY is committed to providing reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities including veterans with disabilities. If you have a disability and either need assistance applying online or need to request an accommodation during any part of the application process, please call 1-800-EY-HELP3, select Option 2 for candidate related inquiries, then select Option 1 for candidate queries and finally select Option 2 for candidates with an inquiry which will route you to EYâ€™s Talent Shared Services Team (TSS) or email the TSS at ssc.customersupport@ey.com
